titleStmt.title: 21st Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (1st Regiment, Indiana Heavy Artillery)

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: 21st Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (1st Regiment, Indiana Heavy Artillery)

body.p: Organized at Indianapolis, Indiana, on July 24, 1861. Re-designated as the 1st Regiment, Indiana Heavy Artillery in February 1863. Mustered out of service in 1866. Commander(s): Colonel John W. McMillan, John A. Keith, and Benjamin F. Hays.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. II, 1861-1865 (Indianapolis: W. R. Holloway, State Printer 1865), p. 194, 199, 208-9.
